intro: Cacalia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers make it easily identifiable. It is often found in California and has adapted to thrive in arid environments.
